it.polimi.se2019.server.playeractions

Class PlayerAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.server.playeractions.PlayerAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Targetable, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GrabPlayerAction, MovePlayerAction, NoOperation, PowerUpAction, ReloadPlayerAction, RespawnAction, ShootPlayerAction, ShootWeaponSelection

    public abstract class PlayerAction
extends java.lang.Object
implements Targetable
    PlayerAction objects are used by the Controller to modify the Model after the View sends a valid Request
    Author:
    Rodolfo Mariotti
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerAction

        public PlayerAction(Game game,
                    Player player)
        Constructor used to build a PlayerAction object.
        Parameters:
        game - reference to the model
        player - the player that needs to run the action

      • PlayerAction

        public PlayerAction(int amount)
        This constructor is only used to build nameplate instances of the object, designed for the MovePlayerAction in particular. The instances are mainly used to retrieve the Id of the different subclasses and the distance for a MovePlayerAction.
        Parameters:
        amount - is the parameter that indicates the distance.

    • Method Detail

      • unpack

        public abstract void unpack(java.util.List<Targetable> params)
                     throws UnpackingException
        This method is used to set the attributes of the object without using the controller. The params vector should contain all the data that needs to be set by the playerAction.
        Parameters:
        params - contains data to "initialize" the object
        Throws:
        UnpackingException - the params does not contains enough data or the data is corrupted/malformed

      • run

        public abstract void run()
        This method is used to apply the effect of the player action. The model will be edited by accessing the game attribute that contains a reference to the game. This method it's called by the controller after running the check() method

      • check

        public abstract boolean check()
        This method is used to check if this player action is valid. It runs some correctness tests and return true if the action is runnable.
        Returns:
        true if the action is runnable and false if it is not

      • getErrorMessage

        public ErrorResponse getErrorMessage()
        This method returns the error message that the controller will send to the view to in case this actions is not runnable
        Returns:
        fancy error message that should be shown to the player

      • getCard

        public abstract Card getCard()
        Returns the card used in this action.
        Returns:
        card used for this actions

      • getGame

        public Game getGame()
        Getter method for the game attribute.
        Returns:
        reference to the model

      • setGame

        public void setGame(Game game)
        Setter method for the game attribute.
        Parameters:
        game - set the reference to the model used by some methods of this class

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        Getter method for the player attribute.
        Returns:
        the player that requested to run this action

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer(Player player)
        Setter method for the player attribute.
        Parameters:
        player - set the player that requested to run this action

      • getAmount

        public int getAmount()
        Getter method for the amount attribute.
        Returns:
        an attribute often used as a placeholder

      • getErrorToReport

        public java.lang.String getErrorToReport()
        Getter method for the errorToReport attribute.
        Returns:
        the error to report as string

      • setErrorToReport

        public void setErrorToReport(java.lang.String errorToReport)
        Setter method for the errorToReport attribute.
        Parameters:
        errorToReport - set the error message

      • buildCommandDict

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Targetable>> buildCommandDict(java.util.List<Targetable> params)
        This helper method serves as adapter because while the playerAction uses a sorted array to parse the params, the action units require a map because uses named params. This method translates the param array in a map of params.
        Parameters:
        params - sorted array of params
        Returns:
        map of params

      • getAllPossibleActions

        public static java.util.List<PlayerAction> getAllPossibleActions()
        Get a list of all possible action.
        Returns:
        list of possible actions

      • buildErrorMessage

        protected static java.lang.String buildErrorMessage(java.util.List<java.lang.String> stringList)
        Helper method, builds an error message. Basically add spaces and punctuation to the phrase and some fancy symbols.
        Parameters:
        stringList - parts of the message
        Returns:
        fancy error message
